answers.answer: Hi.Does the shaking occur at rest, when using your fingers, or during both?Your symptom is generally non-specific and can be caused by many conditions, including thyroid disorders, diabetes, and vitamin and mineral deficiencies. It can also just be physiologic tremor (normal tremor) that is exacerbated by stress or fatigue.If it is not severe, you could opt to observe your symptoms for the time being. If you are concerned about it, you could consult a physician.Hope this helps.

question: Dear docLast four -Five months i have noticed that some times my finger shakes a little bit . Sime time i have noticed it while shaving , writting etc.Now  i am 34 yrs old male with good built, 78 kgs , 5 ft .8 inch. Geneticaly its nowhere in my family my dad is just right at the age of 70.Pls tel me what is it , is it serious  whether i should consult a doctor , or is it any dificiency which is causing the same.Thanks & RegardsChetan99email: ***@****
title: Finger Shakes
